wikipedia_page.main: Marjorie Corbett (12 May 1912 – 27 July 1995) was a British stage and film actress. Corbett appeared on stage in several of the Aldwych farces. In the 1930s she appeared in nine films, including two adaptations of the Aldwych plays. She appeared as a leading lady in quota quickies such as The Reverse Be My Lot and Michael Powell's The Price of a Song.
